definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: He is a stupendously swift writer.
sentences.chinese: 他是个非常多产的作家。

sentences.english: He is a very productive writer, who wrote a lot of well-known novels.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位多产作家，写了大量为人熟知的小说。

sentences.english: Perhaps I'm more productive, I do better at my job.
sentences.chinese: 也许我能更多产，把工作做得更好。

sentences.english: Running an economically productive house is one of the hallmarks of millionaires.
sentences.chinese: 经济地运营一间多产的房屋，是很多百万富翁的标志。
狄更斯是位多产的小说家。

sentences.english: Being a multi-selling megastar hasn't always been mass adoration and adulation.
sentences.chinese: 作为多产的巨星并不总是有大众崇拜和谄媚。

sentences.english: Through the blending in the Body of Christ, God makes us so fruitful and blessed.
sentences.chinese: 通过在基督身体里的相调，神使我们多产而有福。

sentences.english: He is also a prolific writer for children.
sentences.chinese: 他也是一位多产的儿童文学作家。

sentences.english: He was as indifferent to his powers as they were prolific.
sentences.chinese: 他对于他那多产的创作力漠不关心。

sentences.english: As a productive writer, he writes many novels, which are very popular with the young people.
sentences.chinese: 做一名多产作家，他写了很多深受年轻人喜爱小说。

sentences.english: I want you to be fruitful and multiply, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你们丰收多产，等等。

sentences.english: They have found ways to make more productive use of agricultural land.
sentences.chinese: 他们找到了使农业用地更多产的方法。

sentences.english: But this prolific pace might be part of a problem.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种多产的发展步调可能会带来麻烦。

sentences.english: Writers now use computers to write.
sentences.chinese: 写侦探小说的多产作家。

sentences.english: And it is in England that the world’s most prolific game designer now lives.
sentences.chinese: 也是在英格兰目前居住着世界最多产的游戏策划师。

definition: rare/not familiar (to the speaker)/sth rarely experience/hard to see
source (of a product)/place of origin/manufacturing location
to be pregnant/to produce offspring/to nurture (a development, school of thought, artwork etc)/fig. replete with (culture etc)
